options.title: The Violet Heart
options.description: The grasslands' center. Purple so deep it hurts to look at. Nomad shrines circle it. Nothing grows here except questions.

options.title: First Purple
options.description: Where green grass becomes ultraviolet. The transition line is sharp, unnatural. You can stand with one foot in each world.

options.title: Wine-Stain Oasis
options.description: Water tastes of fermentation. Purple reeds grow thick as walls. You hear singing that might be wind, might be nomads, might be neither.

options.title: Singing Pillars
options.description: Stone monoliths vibrate with subsonic frequencies. Your teeth ache. Something watches from the purple grass, or maybe the pillars are watching.

options.title: The Crystal Markets
options.description: Where traders from every nation gather. Or gathered. Or will gather. Time is negotiable here, and so is everything else.

options.title: Rainbow-Oil Springs
options.description: Iridescent liquid bubbles from the ground. It reflects your face wrong. Smells like burnt sugar and ozone. Don't drink it.

options.title: Mirror-Glass Crossing
options.description: The ground reflects sky so perfectly you can't tell up from down. Walk carefully or fall into yourself.

options.title: The Fallen Tower
options.description: It fell centuries ago but is still falling. You can watch it collapse in slow motion. Don't stand underneath.

options.title: Machine Garden
options.description: Rusted mechanisms grow like trees. Copper vines, iron flowers. Some pieces still move when you're not looking.

options.title: The Clockwork Ruins
options.description: Gears larger than houses, stopped mid-turn. The whole city was a machine. No one remembers what it did.

options.title: Reality Thin
options.description: The air shimmers. You can almost see through to somewhere else‚Äîa city? A desert? Gone before you can focus.

options.title: The Echo Plains
options.description: Your voice returns different. Sometimes in languages you don't speak. Sometimes before you've spoken.

options.title: The Distortion
options.description: Distance lies here. That hill is either a mile away or ten feet. The only way to know is to walk it. The answer changes each time.

options.title: The Black City
options.description: Towers of obsidian glass that drink light. Streets that lead everywhere and nowhere. You've arrived. The gate is open. It's always been open.
